Rainer StropekSoftwareentwicklung mit ChatGPT und GitHub CopilotI'm a backend developer. Show me relevant tutorials.As a backend developer with a focus on serverless architecture, here are some relevant tutorials from the available content that can enhance your backend and cloud-native skills:

API Authentication and Authorization  

This tutorial covers essential API security topics including basic authentication methods like API keys and Basic Auth, advanced mechanisms such as OAuth 2.0 and JWT, and practical implementation scenarios. It also highlights common authorization pitfalls and best practices to secure your APIs effectively. This is crucial for backend developers working with serverless APIs and microservices architectures [1.].


Programming with GitHub Copilot in a Practical .NET Example  

Although focused on .NET, this tutorial demonstrates how AI-assisted coding tools like GitHub Copilot can accelerate backend development workflows. It includes tips on how to integrate AI coding assistants into your development environment, which can be valuable for improving productivity in serverless backend projects [2.].


Agentic Work with GitHub Copilot: Insights, Limits, and Tips for .NET Developers  

This session dives deeper into using GitHub Copilot for writing unit tests and managing complex backend logic with AI assistance. It discusses prompt engineering and critical reflection when using AI tools, which can be beneficial for backend developers aiming to leverage AI in their coding processes [3.].


RAG in Practical Use: Intelligent Code Exploration with GitHub Copilot and Cursor  

This tutorial explains Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and its application in AI developer tools for searching large codebases and generating relevant code snippets. Understanding RAG can help backend developers optimize code search and generation in serverless environments [4.].


API Security Mastery: Comprehensive Guide to Protecting Your APIs  

This broader tutorial series includes lessons on HTTP security headers, OWASP Top 10 API risks, and advanced attack vectors like SSRF and SQL Injection. It is highly relevant for backend developers securing serverless APIs and cloud functions [1.].



These tutorials provide a solid foundation in API security, AI-assisted backend development, and modern coding practices that align well with serverless architecture principles. If you want more specific backend or serverless-focused tutorials, please let me know! 
Enjoy exploring these resources to deepen your backend expertise in the serverless domain.
